akas: Held og lykke, Charlie Denmark (dubbed version)
akas from release info: Held og lykke, Charlie Denmark (dubbed version)

1.title: Duncan Dream House
1.plot: Teddy has a dream where the Muppets pay her a visit.

2.title: Doppel Date
2.plot: In an effort to move on with her relationship with Spencer, Teddy dates a boy who turns out to look exactly like him. Meanwhile, Bob and Gabe buy an extremely sophisticated couch, and PJ is struggling at cooking school.

3.title: Demolition Dabney
3.plot: Gabe has a crush on the new neighbor, Lauren.

4.title: Go Teddy!
4.plot: Teddy decides to join Kelsey on the cheerleading squad.

5.title: Rock Enroll
5.plot: Teddy has a hard time with college applications.

6.title: The Unusual Suspects
6.plot: Teddy has a mystery enemy at school.

7.title: Rat-a-Teddy
7.plot: Teddy wants to have a "girls night out" slumber party.

8.title: Charlie 4, Toby 1
8.plot: Charlie is not excited about sharing her family birthday celebration.

9.title: Futuredrama
9.plot: Charlie tries to apply some of Teddy's wisdom from her video diary.

10.title: Teddy's New Beau
10.plot: Beau convinces Teddy to go to a country western hang out as just friends.

11.title: Teddy's Choice
11.plot: It's Teddy's 18th Birthday, and the family is having a party to celebrate.

12.title: The Bug Prom
12.plot: The family attends the Denver Pest Control Association's annual dance.

13.title: Weekend in Vegas
13.plot: Ivy tricks Teddy into joining her family on a road trip to Las Vegas.

14.title: Fright Knight
14.plot: Teddy and her friends decide to go "Halloween caroling."

15.title: Sister, Sister
15.plot: Teddy runs into Amy's younger sister, Jamie.

16.title: Bob's Beau-Be-Gone
16.plot: When a job offer comes up in Tennesse that Beau just can't turn down, he makes a tough decision.

17.title: Good Luck Jessie: NYC Christmas
17.plot: When Teddy gets accepted into a college in New York City, she goes to New York, alongside P.J. P.J stays at a hot dog cart and gets back together with Skyler. Meanwhile Teddy misses her tour on the subway and meets up with Jessie and Zuri. When a blizzard traps Teddy and P.J in New York City, they decide to stay with Jessie and Zuri.

18.title: Accepted
18.plot: Teddy is disappointed when she is waitlisted at her first choice of college.

19.title: Down a Tree
19.plot: Gabe discovers that PJ is living in the tree-house in the backyard.

20.title: Good Bye Charlie
20.plot: Teddy is leaving for college and is finding it hard to shoot a final video diary for her little sister, Charlie. Meanwhile, Amy and Bob plan a special going away party for Teddy, and a surprise guest, Teddy's former boyfriend Spencer, pays an unexpected but welcomed visit.

1.title: Study Date
1.plot: Amy goes back to work for the first time since having Charlie, leaving Bob home with the kids. Teddy invites Spencer over for a study date since all the kids are supposed to be home helping Bob with Charlie while PJ and Emmett try rehearsing. Unfortunately, Bob falls down the stairs, leaving Teddy to look after Charlie and Gabe while PJ takes Bob to the hospital.

2.title: Baby Come Back
2.plot: Charlie's parents go on a date while her older brothers and sister watch her.

3.title: The Curious Case of Mr. Dabney
3.plot: PJ starts to suspect that their neighbor Mrs. Dabney has murdered her husband. He enlists Gabe to help investigate. Amy and Teddy learn to cross generational borders.

4.title: Double Whammy
4.plot: Teddy becomes the school mascot. Charlie takes her first step.

5.title: Dance Off
5.plot: Teddy and Ivy go on a double date. Gabe tries to get out of homework.

6.title: Charlie Did It!
6.plot: Teddy, Gabe and Charlie are stopped by a store-owner for shoplifting. Charlie did it! The police arrive only hours later, and Teddy is in a hurry to a party. PJ desperately tries to come up with a jingle for Bob's TV commercial.

7.title: Butt Dialing Duncans
7.plot: Bob comes home bearing gifts - smart-phones for Teddy and PJ, who will both learn about butt dialing the hard way, a surprisingly hazardous RC helicopter for Gabe, and an irritatingly "happy-happy-happy" singing plush horse for Charlie.

8.title: Charlie Is 1
8.plot: On Charlie's first birthday, the family remembers the day Charlie was born, and how hard it was for everybody to make it to the hospital; for starters, Amy's doctor had taken the day off from work to host a birthday party for his son; Teddy offers to entertain the children at the party if the doctor goes to the hospital to supervise the birth; P.J. and his father, Bob, are on a fishing trip when a bear invades their car and they hitch a ride to the hospital with two people who drive motorcycles. To top it all off, Gabe was accidentally left home alone and has to be ...

9.title: Up a Tree
9.plot: Teddy and PJ try to prevent their old tree house from being torn down.

10.title: Take Mel Out to the Ball Game
10.plot: Teddy meets her father's estranged Uncle Mel.

11.title: Boys Meets Girls
11.plot: When PJ meets a cute girl, Madison, at his new job at Kwikki Chiki, Emmett becomes jealous that they're spending all their time together. Coincidentally, Amy learns that Bob used to date Madison's mom Katherine. Teddy tries to help Gabe with his classmate Jo who is picking on him.

12.title: Kit and Kaboodle
12.plot: Teddy agrees to watch their mean neighbor's beloved cat, Kaboodle, and Gabe experiences his first crush; Gabe lies about his family to make it seem like he and his crush, Kit, have a lot in common. He tells her that he is an only child living with his mom after his parents' divorce, which is exactly what Kit tells Gabe. Later on, Kit visits Gabe's house and Gabe, with the help of Teddy and older brother P.J., tries to keep it a secret that his parents are together and he has three siblings. Meanwhile, Kaboodle is checked by a cat therapist, who tells Teddy to readjust...

13.title: Teddy's Little Helper
13.plot: Teddy is disappointed when she gets a B in English. She becomes obsessed with getting the teacher to like her. Amy offers to coach Gabe's basketball teams when Bob can't. Will she be any better than Bob?

14.title: Blankie Go Bye-Bye
14.plot: Amy and Bob are having their wedding anniversary. Teddy wants to surprise them. Charlie's blankie goes missing and she won't stop crying, Teddy offers to look for the blankie while Gabe takes the parents to the movies. PJ gets the cake.

15.title: Charlie Goes Viral
15.plot: PJ makes a web video of Charlie that turns her into an internet sensation.

16.title: Duncan's Got Talent
16.plot: Spencer agrees to do a dance routine with Teddy for the school talent show.

17.title: Kwikki Chick
17.plot: Teddy wants a phone, but Bob won't pay for it. The Kwikki Chikki needs to increase sales and PJ gets the idea of giving the business a 'face'. Amy gets competitive at Charlie's music school.

18.title: Charlie in Charge
18.plot: With Amy and Bob unavailable, it's up to Teddy to trick PJ into the dentist's office. This, however, leaves only Gabe to look after Charlie. Surely he is up to it while simultaneously doing a school project with his arch enemy Jo, right?

19.title: Sleepless in Denver
19.plot: When Gabe persuades Amy to let him invite his friends for a sleepover, this unfortunately means that Teddy loses her privacy in the cellar and has to sleep in Charlie's room. The night before an important audition. No problemo, right?

20.title: Girl Bites Dog
20.plot: PJ wants money to buy a car, but Bob refuses to help. Gabe has the money but he makes PJ sign a loan contract. Teddy pays a surprise visit to Spencer's workplace and sees his arm around another girl. Is it what it seems?

21.title: Teddy's Broken Heart Club Band
21.plot: Teddy is having a hard time recovering from her breakup with Spencer.

22.title: Teddy Rebounds
22.plot: Amy wants Gabe to befriend the new kid on the block, PJ and Emmett want a bass player in their band, and since Spencer already has a new girlfriend, Teddy wants a rebound boyfriend. Also, Bob resumes his old passion hobby.

23.title: Pushing Buttons
23.plot: Gabe accuses Charlie of leaving the garage door open.

24.title: Snow Show: Part 1
24.plot: The Duncans take a family vacation at the ski resort where Bob and Amy got married. Teddy encounters a psychic who predicts she'll meet the love of her life. The boys meet an old "friend". PJ chooses a wrong trail - or does he?

25.title: Snow Show: Part 2
25.plot: Still on their family ski trip, Teddy asks Ivy to come meet her.

26.title: Driving Mrs. Dabney
26.plot: It's Teddy's 16th birthday and she needs driving lessons, but Bob won't teach her. When Mrs. Dabney gives Teddy a chance, she takes it. Meanwhile, a dog has followed Gabe home, and though Amy initially wants it gone, she starts to like it.

1.title: Charlie Is 2!
1.plot: On Charlie's second birthday, the whole Duncan family winds up in prison. Teddy, Gabe, and Charlie are arrested for trying to break into a Gurgles concert (Charlie's favorite television show) after Teddy failed to get tickets. P.J. is there for harassing one of the Gurgle actors repeatedly, and Amy and Bob, the parents, are there because they were in possession of a stolen mini-horse, which Bob rented for Charlie's birthday party, completely unaware that the animal was stolen.

2.title: Something's Fishy
2.plot: Teddy is miserable after taking a job dressing as a sea creature.

3.title: Let's Potty
3.plot: Bob tries to potty train Charlie.

4.title: Appy Days
4.plot: Teddy and her best friend Ivy want to go to a party thrown by a senior boy, but their mothers don't allow them to since they've never met the boy. Desperate for permission, they use a phone app to create a fake phone call that sounds as if Teddy's mother is giving Teddy permission to go to the party; when Ivy's mom learns that Teddy's mom, Amy, has supposedly given permission, she allows Ivy to go as well. Then they do the same thing backwards, creating a fake phone call from Ivy's mother so Teddy with be able to attend the party. However, just when it seems their ...

5.title: Duncan vs. Duncan
5.plot: As Bob and Amy plan to spend the weekend in a hotel suite, Teddy and PJ are throwing a party, which is put at risk when Bob and Amy cancel over an argument. Meanwhile, Gabe goes to the cotillion with Jo, where an unexpected problem arise.

6.title: L.A.R.P. in the Park
6.plot: Teddy is happy that Evan walked her home, because she likes how he looks in his swim team swimsuit. Gabe think Evan looks familiar, and later (when he and Teddy are alone) remembers that Evan was at the store buying some roleplaying cards (similar to Pokemon cards). Teddy is dismayed at first that she and Evan don't have much in common, and then works with Gabe to learn the game to impress Evan. She arranges for Evan to "accidentally" discover her "secret love" of the game, and he invites her on a date. She has to bring along Charlie, and then learns that the date is ...

7.title: Battle of the Bands
7.plot: Teddy and P.J. joins forces in an effort to win the battle of the bands.

8.title: The Singin' Dancin' Duncans
8.plot: Amy deems the family unfit for the annual hospital gala.

9.title: Teddy's Bear
9.plot: Amy takes it upon herself to try and solve Teddy's problems.

10.title: Meet the Parents
10.plot: Gabe's teacher wants to talk to his parents. Because she has poor sight, Gabe trusts that PJ and Teddy can impersonate them. Teddy is reluctant to present his boyfriend Derek to her parents. Good luck, Gabe. Good luck, Teddy.

11.title: Gabe's 12-1/2 Birthday
11.plot: PJ becomes Bob's weight loss coach. The Duncans promise Gabe a belated 12th birthday party of his dreams. Teddy and Ivy have a fight, but soon go pay each other a visit to apologize. But, snow forces everyone to stay in.

12.title: The Break Up
12.plot: Teddy is losing interest in Derek, but has a hard time breaking up with him. Meanwhile, PJ and his co-workers at Kwikki Chikki want a raise, and Amy tries to teach Gabe to play hockey.

13.title: Charlie Shakes It Up
13.plot: When Amy, Charlie, and Teddy travel to Chicago to visit a relative, they are mistaken for famous hip-hop dancers and have to dance on "Shake it up Chicago." Meanwhile, back home, P.J. and Gabe have a yard sale to make money off of all their useless junk and accidentally sell their neighbor a cookie jar with five-hundred dollars inside!

14.title: Baby's New Shoes
14.plot: Teddy asks Gabe and his friend to help her come up with a new story to win an internship; P.J. tries to make up for a past wrong; Charlie ruins a pair of shoes.

15.title: Bye Bye Video Diary
15.plot: Teddy's laptop gets accidentally ruined and all her video diaries are gone. Meanwhile, PJ goes to Kwikki Chikki University, and Gabe is spooked after watching a scary movie.

16.title: Monkey Business
16.plot: Teddy and Ivy babysit for the new neighbors, but trouble rises when Teddy loses one of Amy's expensive earrings and goes to great lengths to find it. Meanwhile, Gabe makes Bob think he wins a lot of money so he can go to an amusement park.

17.title: PJ in the City
17.plot: When Skyler unexpectedly moves to New York, PJ decides to go after her. Teddy tries to get a job at a clothing store where Spencer works so she can get a discount on clothes. Gabe is nervous about talking to a girl, so Amy tries to meddle.

18.title: Sun Show: Part 1
18.plot: The Duncan family travels to Hawaii for Bob and Amy's anniversary, and, while playing a game with Charlie, Amy steps onto sacred ground, resulting in a strange man putting a curse on the family. Amy doesn't believe it at first, but when bizarre things begin happening, such as P.J. and Gabe nearly becoming victims of a helicopter crash, Bob getting hit in the head with a golf-ball, Charlie getting lost, and Teddy having a surfing accident. Perhaps worst of all, Amy gets trapped in an elevator and has a serious allergic reaction, causing her entire body to swell up in ...

19.title: Sun Show: Part 2
19.plot: As strange and horrible things continue to plague the Duncan clan, Gabe desperately begs the person who enacted the curse in the first place to remove it so his family will go back to normal.

20.title: Amazing Gracie
20.plot: When Teddy buys a used car from Ivy's dad, it gets wrecked immediately. Amy is upset when Charlie starts pre-school and thinks that she doesn't miss her. Gabe and PJ try to get out of going with Bob on a fishing trip by finding him friends.

21.title: Termite Queen
21.plot: Teddy agrees to go with Bob to his bug convention so she can get him to buy her a new car. Meanwhile, PJ's friend from Kwikki Chikki University comes to stay with the Duncans. Gabe and Jake make a monster movie with Charlie as the monster.

22.title: The Bob Duncan Experience
22.plot: Gabe and his friend Leo open up a lemonade stand, but after a fight, they end up competing against one another. Meanwhile, Teddy tries to avoid going to the homecoming with Emmett, and PJ accidentally breaks Bob's old band's album.

23.title: Ditch Day
23.plot: Teddy is upset when she hears that she is known as G.G. (Goodie Goodie) at school and decides ditch school to get rid of it. Meanwhile, Gabe tries to get ungrounded so he can go to an amusement park.

24.title: Alley Oops
24.plot: Mary Lou wins an audition to sing the national anthem. Teddy is excited because she is promised the car that Mary Lou wins, but her plan soon hits a snatch. Meanwhile, the Duncans plays an annual bowling match against a rival family.

25.title: Scary Had a Little Lamb
25.plot: Teddy and Ivy take Charlie trick-or-treating, but after being tricked by the neighbor kid, Teddy and Ivy plan revenge. Meanwhile, Mrs. Dabney tricks Gabe so he has to work a full day for her, and PJ goes goth to impress his new girlfriend.

26.title: Return to Super Adventure Land
26.plot: Gabe and Amy are asked to appear in a commercial for Super Adventure Land, and Amy tries to steal the spotlight. Meanwhile, Teddy gets a job at SAL, but it means working closely with Emmett. Bob is over the moon for PJ's cooking skills.

27.title: Can You Keep a Secret?
27.plot: Teddy and Spencer get back together, and she has a hard time telling her family. Meanwhile, Gabe tries to collect money so he can buy a new game console, and PJ finds out the truth about his name.

28.title: Story Time
28.plot: After listening to a bad children's book in Charlie's preschool class, Teddy and Amy decide to write their own book. Meanwhile, Gabe picks Bob to go to career day at his school, and PJ counsels a couple who has trouble with their marriage.

29.title: It's a Charlie Duncan Thanksgiving
29.plot: Amy finally gets to stay home and cook Thanksgiving dinner this year, but PJ has other plans. Meanwhile, Bob's father starts dating Mrs. Dabney, to Bob and Gabe's horror; Teddy and Ivy are buying cheap MyTabs, but they get some competition.

30.title: Teddy on Ice
30.plot: Teddy's getaway trip with Ivy's family to their lake house turns out differently than expected. Meanwhile, Amy and Bob try to investigate where Charlie learned a bad word, and Gabe and PJ get into a daytime show Mrs. Dabney watches.

1.title: Make Room for Baby
1.plot: Amy is pregnant and decides that the family has to move, although the other Duncans are against it. Meanwhile, Teddy and Spencer work on a Super Adventure Land gig, and Gabe is pranked by Mrs. Dabney and decides to get the last laugh.

2.title: Bad Luck Teddy
2.plot: Teddy's schoolmates think that she is a jinx because the basketball team has been losing games ever since her and Spencer got back together, so she and Spencer stage a fake break-up to convince people the rumor isn't true. Bob thinks it's time for P.J. to get his hair cut at a barber shop that doesn't give out lollipops and stickers, and P.J.'s against it - until he falls in love with his new hairdresser. Meanwhile, Gabe overhears his parents talking in the kitchen and jumps to the conclusion that they're shipping him off to military school, so he decides to become ...

3.title: Amy Needs a Shower
3.plot: Amy has Mary Lou throw her a baby shower specifically to get good gifts.

4.title: Dress Mess
4.plot: Amy wants Teddy to wear her old dress to prom, much to Teddy's chagrin.

5.title: Catch Me If You Can
5.plot: Teddy and Spencer hide a secret from Amy.

6.title: Name That Baby
6.plot: Bob and Amy have everyone in the family start weighing in with baby names.

7.title: Special Delivery
7.plot: Amy tries to avoid giving birth to the new baby on Charlie's birthday, so she and Teddy have to get creative so the baby pops out before then. Gabe gets fifty dollars to buy a doll for the birthday, but ends up buying a video game instead.

8.title: Welcome Home
8.plot: Charlie's new baby brother comes home and Bob's mother comes home to help too. Unfortunately, Amy doesn't really like her mother-in-law, so Teddy steps in to help.

9.title: Baby's First Vacation
9.plot: The Duncan's take a quick trip to Dead Man's Lake.

10.title: Wentz's Weather Girls
10.plot: Harry Wentz decides to follow his dreams and open up a new restaurant.

11.title: Baby Steps
11.plot: PJ and Emmett get an apartment together, but Amy is not prepared.

12.title: T. Wrecks
12.plot: When Teddy joins the volleyball team, she realizes she is not very good.

14.title: Team Mom
14.plot: Amy volunteers to be "team mom" for Teddy's volleyball team.

15.title: Le Halloween
15.plot: For Halloween, Amy dresses up like a Kangaroo.

16.title: Guys & Dolls
16.plot: Bob tries to help Spencer out of a fight.

17.title: Nurse Blankenhopper
17.plot: Amy gets a part time nursing job at Gabe's school.

18.title: The Charlie Whisperer
18.plot: Teddy cannot get Charlie to perform in the community play.

19.title: Study Buddy
19.plot: PJ starts reading Charlie a book and becomes obsessed with finishing it.

20.title: A Duncan Christmas
20.plot: Teddy has been assigned the task of taking Charlie to see Santa.

21.title: All Fall Down
21.plot: Spencer gets the opportunity to start college in Boston early.

locations: Los Angeles Center Studios - 450 S. Bixel Street, Downtown, Los Angeles, California, USA
Sunset Bronson Studios - 1438 N. Gower Street, Hollywood, Los Angeles, California, USA::(studio)
501 Palmetto Drive, Pasadena, California, USA::(Exterior: Duncan House)
imdb.plot outline: Teenagers Teddy and PJ Duncan and their 10-year-old brother, Gabe, are enlisted to help raise the newest addition to their family, Charlotte (nicknamed "Charlie"), when their parents return to work. With their parents juggling full time careers, they pitch in, getting very familiar with baby formula, burps, clothes, and babysitting while navigating typical teenage life.
imdb.title: Good Luck Charlie
plot: The Duncan family are adjusting to the surprise birth of their fourth child, Charlie. When parents Amy and Bob return to work they put their latest addition in the care of her three older siblings.::Anonymous

Teenagers Teddy and PJ Duncan and their 10-year-old brother, Gabe, are enlisted to help raise the newest addition to their family, Charlotte (nicknamed "Charlie"), when their parents return to work. With their parents juggling full time careers, they pitch in, getting very familiar with baby formula, burps, clothes, and babysitting while navigating typical teenage life.::Official site

High-School teenagers, Teddy and PJ Duncan, and their 10-year old brother, Gabe, are responsible for getting used to the newest addition to their family. A new baby named Charlie. When their parent's have to return to work, the children have the responsibility to watch over Charlie and take care of her all while trying to survive their teenage lives.
synopsis: Good Luck Charlie is an original Disney Channel television sitcom, which premiered April 4, 2010. The series was created by Phil Baker and Drew Vaupen, who wanted to create a program that would appeal to entire families, as opposed to children only. It revolves around a Denver family, the Duncans, as they try to adjust to the birth of their fourth child, Charlotte "Charlie" Duncan (Mia Talerico). In each episode, Teddy Duncan (Bridgit Mendler) creates a video diary containing advice for Charlie about their family and life as a teenager. Teddy tries to show Charlie what she might go through when she is older in the video diaries for future reference. Each video diary ends with Teddy (or someone else from the family, even Charlie) saying the eponymous phrase, "Good luck, Charlie."Among other decisions, executives included adult-centric scenes and changed the series title from Oops to Love, Teddy and finally to Good Luck Charlie in order to ensure the series would appeal to all family members. Good Luck Charlie premiered on Disney Channel in the United States on April 4, 2010.[1] It premiered in Canada on April 5, 2010, the United Kingdom and Ireland on May 14, 2010, and in Australia and New Zealand on July 23, 2010. Good Luck Charlie was renewed for a second season, with production beginning in August 2010 with a season premiere on February 20, 2011.[2] A feature-length Christmas Disney Channel Original Movie based on the series entitled Good Luck Charlie, It's Christmas! began production in March 2011 for a December 2011 premiere.[3] On August 29, 2011, Disney Channel announced that they had renewed the series for a third season.[3] The third season premiered on May 6, 2012.
